title: The Geographical Distribution of Subway Usage Decrease Due to COVID-19
description:
This tutorial demonstrates how to use Mapbox Storytelling with our previous web mapping example. Here we will use Mapbox storytelling template to first, give an overview of the decrease in subway usage around the city, and second, zoom into three different locations that exemplify the diversity of conditions around New York.

We will use the previous web map displaying MTA turnstile data as the basis for our story. In this process we will use Mapbox GL JS, as well as Intersection Observer and Scrollama as our main JavaScript libraries.

chapters.title: No water at home
chapters.description: In 2015 only 56% of the population in Niger had acces to drinking water.Imagine you would live in the same surcumstances as in Niger and wouldn't have access to a save water source at or near your home, which means you would have to walk for water for you and your family

chapters.title: The radius youd have to find water in
chapters.description: The average women and girls walk for water in Niger is 6 kilometers. The circle shows you how far a radius of 6 kilometers can actually reach.

chapters.title: The watersource
chapters.description: Today you'll have to fetch water from this source: show source name here. This water source is __show distance you have to walk here__

chapters.title: The route you'd have to walk
chapters.description: The route you will be walking takes approximately __time it takes to wak here__ back and forth

chapters.title: You start walking at 9
chapters.description: You will be needing something to bring the water back home in. As they mainly use jerrycans for this in Niger this is what you will be using today. In the top right corner the time your walk for water takes is displayed

chapters.title: Arrival
chapters.description: After walking for __amount of hourse displayed here__ you finally arrive at the water source. Doesn't look save to drink right? In 2017 the annual death rate in Niger because of unsafe water sources counted 18586. Girls are 3x more likely to be malnutritioned by unsafe water which is usually caused by diahrrea.

chapters.title: Filling up
chapters.description: Now that you funally filled up your jerrycan with water it's time to return home. The jerrycan is filled with 20 liters of water which roughly equals 20 bottles of milk weighing 20 kilometers.

chapters.title: physical stress
chapters.description: Halfway back your body starts aching ecause you're carrying the jerrycan on your back. Most women carry these jerrycans on their head, back or shoulders which results in a lot of physical stress.

chapters.title: The return
chapters.description: After coming home you look at the clock and realize you've just spend __amount of time spend total__. It's now __current time__ this means that you missed a whole day of school. This is pretty standard in Niger as in 2018 the literacy rate for people between 15 and 24 years old was only 43%.

randomSourceEvents.title: Conflict
randomSourceEvents.description: In countries like Niger, water is unevenly distributed in both time and space, which often leads to water shortages and can evolve into heated disputes, or even violence.
